titleStmt.title: Lega Toscana di Protezione Meeting Minutes: Volume 1

respStmt.resp: Meeting minutes transcribed from scanned immages
TEI file created from transcribed minute log for academic use

respStmt.orgName: Center for the Digital Text at the University of Pittsburgh, Greensburg

availability.p:
The materials transcribed below are available for public use in the Detre Library
& Archives located in the Heinz History Center. Materials cannot be removed
from the library and archives, but sharing of the documents digitally for
educational purposes is encouraged, with full and proper citation.

msIdentifier.repository: Detre Library & Archives, Italian American Collection

handDesc.p:
This volume of minutes was written by the correspondance secretary of the
year 1923, Ernesto Vigano'.

accMat.p:
The meeting minutes contain, in addition to written record of meetings, expense sheets that describe account balances and any spending or receipt of
money by the organization.

origin.p:
The manuscript was compiled by Lega members during the monthly meetings that
took place in Pittsburgh, PA. This file contains meeting minutes that span
from January to December of 1923.

acquisition.p:
The manuscript documents were donated to theHeinz
History CenterbyLaura
Bocelli-Vondasin two portions - the first in 2015 and the
second in 2017.

settingDesc.p:
This file contains meeting minutes from the year 1923. Meetings were held monthly and
were typically held in the same location near the downtown area of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

textDesc.factuality:
The meeting minutes were handwritten accounts of discussions
held, decisions, or money allocated made during the meetings.

abstract.p:
This research study is a collaborative effort between four undergraduate students and
one faculty member at the University of Pittsburgh in Pittsburgh, PA to explore
geographical, linguistic, and anthropological information regarding members and
affiliates of the Lega Toscana di Protezione, a Pittsburgh-based beneficial society
of Tuscan Italian immigrants. The primary purpose of this specific file is to contain
specially marked-up renditionsof the transcribed minutes in order to create a social
network mapping that will illuminate relationships and dynamics between both members
of the Lega and those in the greater community based on varied types of interactions
represented within the minutes log.
